title: Case Management Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Panel asking job related questions. Didn't find it to be difficult if you know the responsibilities of an acute hospital case manager. I interviewed 1stcwith manager then 2nd interview with staff
Interview Questions: Questions are job related like 1) what is an important function of case management which is priority setting 2) How do you respond to challenging patients and family members

title: Oncology Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Spent time with oncology managers, received a tour and got to meet the pharmacists currently staffing as well as the oncology technicians, had a group interview with managers and other oncology pharmacists at the site.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Met with the nursing manager who walked me through the unit to where we would be having the meeting. Panel made up of 4 people from the Unit. Interview took place in a conference room. Very professional and welcoming.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself Describe a time when you were involved in conflict and how it was resolved.

title: DEI Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Call with recruiter to discuss background and experience. This was a screener and did not go in depth regarding skills. After this call I got an email a few weeks later stating that I was no longer considered for the position, but that they may be expanding the program in the future.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Patient Services Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: It's very simple and straightforward. It's two interviews before you get through to the position. They focus upon the company's values in order to show whether or not you will be a good fit.
Interview Questions: What is good customer service to you?

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: A few virtual interviews with the library manager. Standard process, clear next steps. Nothing too intense or scary. Felt like a conversation, and questions were welcome. Follow up within a few days.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with literature searching?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Situational behavioral questions, it was smooth, everyone was very kind. The interviews were about an hour long. They asked questions about how I handled specific scenarios and wanted me to provide specifics
Interview Questions: Describe a time when I had to respond to an emergency

title: Youth and Family Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very in-depth and friendly. Portions included online, phone-call, and in-person. Also was able to meet the team and ask them any questions I had. Received feedback very quickly.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to pursue this position

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was over zoom. The interviewer was very nice and to the point. She just went over my resume with me and asked questions about previous jobs. She asked what I was looking for in an employer. Then 3 days later I received a job offer.
Interview Questions: Best and worst qualities I have with Healthcare.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Great it was very friendly and easy to understand the question and get through the interview it was very quick and straight to the point asked if you ever worked there before also
Interview Questions: How do you like working with elderly

title: Front Desk Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Casual, in the breakroom of the department. Group interview with several interviewers. They were friendly and easy going, but there were not a lot of hard-hitting questions, and it was clear that the position did not have a great degree of difficulty.
Interview Questions: How do I prioritize tasks?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Meet with the Office Manager, 2nd interview met with the Office manager and Doctor. Met with them for 30 minutes. got a job offer 2 weeks later. Office manager asked simple questions
Interview Questions: what are your weakest points

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Took a while to hear back from the initial submission of my application and resume but they were very patient and professional throughout the process. Their email communication was prompt and their recruiters were very helpful
Interview Questions: Past work experience and education

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: scheduling patient for appts. for xrays and other images that their doctors would order. and any other appts that we need to help the patients set so that they would receive the health care that they needed,
Interview Questions: okay needs to change their training

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Long process. Phone interview followed by multiple rounds of in person interviews. Now those are being done by Zoom. At one point they will do a team interview to see how you fit with the people you work with.  They are very thorough and can take a while to get back to you
Interview Questions: Strengths and Weaknesses. Tell us about a time you made a mistake at work and what you did. Tell us about a time you lead a project. Tell us about a time you did a support role.

title: Night Custodian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: I put in an application an heard back about a week later. It was a simple phone interview and I was asked about all my previous experience. All in all, it was a straight forward process.
Interview Questions: Do you have custodial experience in a hospital?

title: Content & Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: First interview was with the hiring manager and his colleague who was a part time employee. Second interview was a panel interview. All done via Zoom. The interviewers were friendly enough but the first interviewer was very rude and dismissive with my answers. Very condescending and did not make a good impression!
Interview Questions: What is you experience with creating communications plans?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Video interview; 45 min long. HR and director of department present. Opportunity to ask questions at the end of interview. Easy to attend and low stress. Questions were not too difficult, though some were very specific.
Interview Questions: Tell me about the most critically ill patient you have cared for and how you provided that care.

title: Phleobotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview took about 30 minutes.  Questions asked were about situations that came up in previous experiences and how they were handled. Some questions were about hypothetical situations and how they would be handled.
Interview Questions: If you had to explain a procedure to a patient how would you make sure they understood.

title: Patient Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: It was a typical interview process with regular interview questions. The interviewers showed me around after and introduced me to the rest of the staff after the interview. Overall, it was a pretty normal interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: SLH Health Network is accused of conducting "Hiring Discrimination" particularly when it pertains to Veterans.  SLH has failed to offer a single interview of any of the more than dozen RN positions I applied for as a qualified and competent healthcare provider.  They are falsely advertising for sign on bonuses but are dismissing candidate applications without even offering interviews.  Shame on you SLH...SHAME ON YOU!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Behavioral Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Initial screening interview and then a follow up interview by the hiring manager. Questions were very straight forward and asked about past experiences and what to expect in this position
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Chesterfield, MO) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very quick process from beginning to end. I was offered a job within a week of submitting an application. Everything is online which makes the process much smoother. Everyone I dealt with was super friendly.
Interview Questions: Experience in healthcare so far. Why did you choose to become a nurse.

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: There was an email that was used to set up a zoom interview. Unfortunately, they were able to see me, but I was unable to see them, only hear their voices.
Interview Questions: No question was unexpected.  It was a board interview so there were a wide variety of questions. Very thorough.

title: Occupational Health and Safety Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a one-hour 5-person panel interview that included staff from Employee Safety and Well-being.  Healthcare experience is not required, but it is desired.  The interview focused on common hazards encountered in Healthcare such as safe patient handling, ergonomics, blood and bodily fluid exposure and respiratory protection.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with respiratory protection and fit testing?

title: Information Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was quick and easy. Lots of questions based on previous work experience and health system values. Describe personal traits and how others might describe you and your strengths/weaknesses. Overall simple questions and average for a job interview.
Interview Questions: How would current or previous coworkers or supervisors describe you and your work habits?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview. Management only. Unable to have peer interview.  Offered job hours after interview. Would have liked to have the opportunity for a peer interview. Asked basic get to know you questions. Some scenarios and examples of past experiences.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to deal with a difficult coworker

title: Senior Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: It was so smooth and streamlined, excellent recruitment process. They explained the process very well about the hiring and scheduled everything well in advance. They were very transparent on the process as well.
Interview Questions: SQL Server, .Net and Cloud

title: Revenue Cycle Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview was average. I got the impressions they had no intention to hire me even though hiring manager said I was plenty qualified. Take the time to send a personal rejection after two interviews.
Interview Questions: Standard situational and strength weakness questions.

title: Sellsman Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and friendly easy to work with and very helpful they were ver well organized and I didn't interview but this website is very stupid and want me to put information so ignore everything I sayed
Interview Questions: How are you doing today

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Easy, flowed well.  Talked with recruiters first who described company well.  Not intimidating.  Two different interview sessions.  Seemed like a good company as one of Idaho's largest.  Would have accepted if I would have decided to leave my current job.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking to leave past employer?

title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Interviews are generally done by a panel from the unit you are applying for.  Questions covered different aspects of the position within that unit. The interview was kept relaxed and comfortable.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you had a conflict with a coworker.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, online zoom call, one on one with floor manager- not panel. First interview was with HR representative, second interview with floor manager was offered approx 2hr later. Interview lasted approximately 30 minutes and was question and short answer format, and was recorded.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: HR Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: My interview was pretty easy going. I was in a panel interview with 4 interviewers. The questions were pretty straight forward. Lots of situational questions. Asked about organization and communication skills.
Interview Questions: How would you prioritize you day by A,B and C tasks and why

title: PCA II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Houston, TX) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Great, not so long and easy and everything was thoroughly explained to me. Job details, hours and units  were explained to me. She made she sure I knew everything I needed to know about the position.
Interview Questions: Why you chose to work with us?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: simple and fast. Had one interview and was given a offer literally 15 mins after the interview ended. I was shocked honestly because i know its a 2 interview process.
Interview Questions: basic interview questions why do you want to work for us, strengths and weaknesses

title: Student Nurse Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: It was very short, only about 15 minutes long.  it was on zoom so a lot of people had technical difficulties. The questions they asked were pretty straight forward and the interviewer was very friendly.
Interview Questions: Why did you chose St. Luke's?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then short in person interview. Very simple and informal. My interviewer was very nice and was a good listener. I was nervous at first but it ended up being pretty easy
Interview Questions: Three strengths and weaknesses about yourself

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application online. The next day received an email from a Recruiter requesting an initial discussion  (to pre-screen). Following that discussion, I received a call from another recruiter with a request for an interview and to include a portfolio. Interviewed with 3 individuals - for about an hour. They were very kind and transparent about struggles. They also asked me standard interview questions. I received an offer later that day.  Overall it was a good experience.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your background.
How do you deal with conflict?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Allentown, PA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: It went great they were friendly and polite. They were totally professional and made you feel confident and comfortable. I am hoping the grass is greener over here. My husband and I recently moved into the area so fingers crossed
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Lees Summit, MO)
Interview Descriptions: It lasted 23 min. Phone interview. 3 people on the other line. Questions about work. Behavioral questions. After the interview. They let me ask questions. After q and a. HR discussed uniform to wear and what should not, also perks and benefits, and then if I have nore questions, I can email her anytime.  I hesistated to ask if I was hired or not so Im currently waiting for their call. She also said that I can check the progress of my application in their website.
Interview Questions: What are your strength? What are the areas you want to improve? If there are 4 pts on the call lights, which one will you answer first. How will you keep your patient safe? How did you handle a difficult patient? How did your work with a difficult coworker? How did you cope with a change in your workplace?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Cedar Rapids, IA)
Interview Descriptions: phone interview,  in person interview.  Job shadow with other nurses, doctors.  continued in person interview. Job offer was over the phone from HR.    Got back to them by phone.  Offer, start date, orientation, etc.  Easy and painless.
Interview Questions: tell me a bit about yourself

title: Registration Services Agent Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was lengthy but easy to go through, overall fair and good, would be happy to do it again, i understand the length  of the interview given the field of work. The application itself was quite easy as well.
Interview Questions: If I had previous related job experience.

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Kansas City, MO) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was easy to set up and it was very straightforward. I thought they were extremely kind and professional toward me. It was a nice experience and I would recommend interviewing with them.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in an emplyer?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with manger, then team interview, then interview with higher up manager. They want to see if you're a good fit for the culture of the company. Everyone is super nice and wants you to succeed in the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your career journey.

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: it was good, it lasted about a couple of weeks from the time I applied to when I got an interview.  I have a phone interview with them in a couple of days. they were nice and asked the common interview behavioral questions and some things about yourself.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself  ?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself was about 45 minutes and HR went pretty in-depth in wanting to know about clinical experiences. However, it was made to feel comfortable the entire time and felt like a conversation.
Interview Questions: If we were to ask previous supervisors, what would they say about you and your work?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview with typical questions about previous experience in areas such as customer service and how you deal with stressful situations. There were two interviews that took turns asking questions.
Interview Questions: How would you react if the person working with you didn't like the way you handled a patient?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very professional. Mostly consisted of questions asking how I would handle certain situations. We spoke briefly on my previous work history and how i thought it would apply to my new situation
Interview Questions: What would you do in ( insert situation here)

title: Telehealth Nurse Educator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Phone panel interview with multiple people from the TeleHealth department.  Everyone was really friendly and welcoming.   Asked pretty average questions...tell me about yourself.  What would your co-workers say is a strength of yours and an area for improvement.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a mistake you made.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I did a phone interview then an in-person interview. I did not like that I did not know the rate of pay until after I received a job offer. They offered me $37,500 and wanted me to drive all over Missouri for my case load. I did not think the pay way fair and turned down the offer. I also did not like that I had to get a job offer in order to know what the pay was, because the responsibilities were a lot.
Interview Questions:
How do you handle telling a client bad news?
What is your biggest accomplishment?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Meridian, ID) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions:
My interview was online due to COVID.  I received a call to set up a time for my interview. The interview wasn't long and drawn out and the general attitude was very relaxed. I was given all the information related to the position so I wouldn't have any surprises if hired. 

Everyone I have worked with was very upbeat and happy. The recruiter seemed just as excited to offer me a position as I was to receive the offer.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of ordinary, standard interview questions.

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Everything went Fairly quickly. Interview took 45 minutes with standard interview questions. I applied online and was contacted by a recruiter within one business day via email. Interview happened via telephone and had a response within same day.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you made a mistake and how did you correct it

title: Patient Access Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty quick and simple. It was over teams with no video. I had two women who interviewed me, and both asked about two questions each. The interview took a total of fifteen minutes.
Interview Questions: Does your supervisor know that you are looking for another job, and that you are in this interview?

title: New Graduate Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Houston, TX) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process was very organized and straight forward. It was done via indviudal interviews conducted by a panel of nurse leaders.  The nurse leaders were very receptive to questions about their individual units.
Interview Questions: Behavioral style questions that asked the interviewee to respond to various patient scenarios.

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter by email, and was then contacted by the clinic manager for an in-person interview. Along with the clinic manager, I met with 2 other individuals that worked in the clinic.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths? Concerns?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (New York, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: They were really professional and courteous and that stayed 6 feet away from me the whole time while wearing their diaper chin the whole time. They also sneezed into the elbows which I appreciate since the CDC advises you do. They also wore 3 masks which was above and beyond CDC guidelines for 2 which I appreciated but also thought the person that was interviewing me was about to pass out because of lack of oxygen. I knew they would be okay because they said they were ON blood type.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward and easy. Normal interview questions. Some behavioral questions as well as skills focused questions. Took a few weeks to receive an interview after applying, and then about 3 days to hear back.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Revenue Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, after two weeks I took a phone interview. The phone interview last one hour with two interviewers. Interviewers asked a lot structured questions, so you better prepare as many questions as you can.
Interview Questions: What is you three biggest weakness.

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview lasted about 30 minutes. The questions were pretyped and laid out on a piece of paper but they were typical questions you'd be asked at any interview. The interviewers didnt seem very personable.
Interview Questions: Describe a problem in the workplace and how did you solve it?

title: CNA/HHA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Oswego, NY) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy and you can be working within 2 weeks. They went over certain policies, what I needed like my vaccination records. They asked me a few questions on my experience and what I want to do in my future.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a bad situation with a fellow co worker

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Mountain Home, ID) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough and relaxed while providing immediate feedback. Was made to feel comfortable while also lending insight on the current team and daily procedures.  Was informed of hours available and potential compensation.
Interview Questions: What makes you the best candidate for this position?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I received an email offering an interview with various times to choose from.  I arrived early and therefore started early and it was very casual, no scripted questions.  Just some questions about why I applied for the position and if I would be okay doing phones and desk work.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, 2 weeks later HR called to schedule an interview, 3 days later I interviewed, later the same day the manager called and told me I got the job!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Brief over the phone interview with recruiter discussing pass work history and behavior questions.  However, interview seem to go good and recruiter advised to expect to hear something back by Monday no later and I never heard anything back. Not a yes or no and was lost. But out of nowhere a whole new recruiter emailed me on a Sunday morning advising thanks for my time not interested.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you wish you did something different ?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Meridian, ID)
Interview Descriptions: This hiring process at St. Luke’s is a joke! The recruiters take forever to get in touch with you, if they ever even do. Sometimes you just never hear anything at all. Sometimes you get impersonal emails to let you know you didn’t get the job after you interview multiple times. It takes forever to hear anything, so you are left wondering for weeks what is actually going on. Then, if you are lucky enough to actually hear back from anyone, they don’t really have any answers for what is going on with the job. The interview was also strange, I didn’t realize there would be 4 people at my interview, and it caught me off guard.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Interviews with other physicians in my field and administration. As St Luke’s covers many different hospitals through the state, I had to travel and interview at different locations.  This wasn’t a major limitation, just need to be prepared for a multi day interview I’d you will be working at the various sites.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to move to Idaho?

title: Md Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Allentown, PA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very good  ,quiet atmosphere,relaxed,,on time,easygoing,friendly,questions were appropriate,,no pressure,information presented clearly,options discussed ,follow up interviews  were discussed ,stress was reduced during interview,no high stress questions ,no special questions ,gave me options to ask questions that were important to me
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Allentown, PA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer answered questions clearly, which was helpful and eliminated the need to read in between the lines. The interview setting/mood was formal yet very relaxed. The overall process was straightforward and professional.
Interview Questions: What qualities do you bring that our further our team's cause and be an asset to the health organization?

title: Connect Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied on their career portal for this position and was contacted via email to come to their group interview one week later.
The group interview was held at their business office on Shoreline in downtown Boise.
There were about 8 managers, and there were 18 applicants (16 women, 2 men) vying for 3 positions.
Each manager took one applicant and a team of 2 managers interviewed the one person and then they got to leave.
The applicant doesn't meet with all the managers, and some don't even meet with a manager who is actually hiring.  All the applications/resumes are on the table and the managers just come in and grab one, so it's simply luck of the draw on who you interview with and if you get to talk to someone who actually has an opening. We're assuming that if you are fantastic, someone who isn't hiring is going to tell someone who is about you.  Though that doesn't sound right ....
They have a list of questions but some interviews last longer than others so it didn't appear that all managers asked all questions.
There was no information given about next steps. 
And as of a month later, there was no communication one way or the other thereafter.
Interview Questions: What would you do if someone from another area came and asked for your help when you have your own tasks to do and you really need to get it done.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview questions were behavioral.  If you look up 'Behavioral Interview Questions' in preparation, you'll see  a lot of what will be asked.  Turn around time from HR was slow on every step of the process.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to interact with a difficult client. What was the situation, and how did you handle it?

title: PTA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Spokane, WA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very formal and professional with engaging questions and the time was taken to really explain the position, roles in the company, opportunity for growth, and more.
Interview Questions: What are long term and short term goals for your career?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and relaxed atmosphere. The process at St Luke's is very long from applying to interview, if you get one. They never called to say yes or no so you don't know why you weren't picked.
Interview Questions: How would I handle a nurse asking me to do something when I have someone on the line and a patient at my desk.

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for a non-clinical position. Called the day before interview to come in for a group interview for 3 hours. Accepted, 3 other candidates in group interview, panel of 4. One week later called for second interview, this time one on one with hiring manager and one other employee. Two weeks later received job offer. Two weeks later attended pre employment screening and a week later started position. Screening includes background check, drug test, nicotine testing, blood tests (not for drugs - for health purposes), and physical exam.
Interview Questions:
What are you strengths? Weaknesses? 

Describe a time where you did not agree with a manager and how you handled it?

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Kansas City, MO)
Interview Descriptions:
Meet with HR; they go over your resume and ask you the same generic questions 
They contact your references and won't get hired until they get a hold of your references. HR will lie and say they contacted even if they didn't (you have to be diligent yourself and sometimes get your references to contact HR).
Interview Questions: Please go over the responsibilities of "one of your" jobs

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with a panel. Set up was pretty typical. However, the questions seemed to be a little 'in the weeds", like how do you organize your work? Seemed to be skeptical that I could manage multiple small projects because most of my experience was with larger scale projects. Almost felt like they were intimidated by my experience.
Interview Questions: Question related to my ability to manage multiple small projects as my experience was mostly on larger scale projects.

title: HR- Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: First, it was a phone screen. The second interview I met with a group of five members of the HR Team at the office. They did a round robin of different questions regarding my experience.
Interview Questions:
What did you like about your last position?
What type of culture are you looking for in a company?
What was your last role day-to-day activities?

title: EMR Data Integrity Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: As an internal applicant, I was called by a recruiter and scheduled for an interview.  I met with the hiring manager and another member of the team right down the hall from where I work.
Interview Questions: They asked me how I would handle difficult customers.

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID)
Interview Descriptions: Very in depth.  Had five people present to do interview  and had to wait for them to review to move on to next step.  Open to questions and comments and provided guidance in process.   It was to make for a good match for both employee and employer
Interview Questions: Why I was interested in their position

title: BI Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: My two interviewers played to good cop, bad cop game with me, and in keeping with that drama, both were deceitful. Bad cop guy continually interrupted me, repeatedly barked "No, you can't say I don't know; you have to try at an answer" and then gave a smack-down to whatever I offered up. Condescending and arrogant. Good cop gal was the more deceitful -- at the end she said "Heck, we're out of time, let's talk again," but of course that was BS; by the time I got online to check, sure enough they had re-posted the position and of course never followed up. The HR guy who set it up was similarly covertly hostile. The whole thing was unprofessional in the extreme.
Interview Questions: Show us that you know everything about BI architecture, MDM, DW, Federated Systems, and Big Data.

title: Payroll/Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really pretty straight forward, other than dealing with two different recruiters telling me different things. I met with 2 very nice individuals from the HR/Compensation department. Pretty standard questions, What was your favorite job, least favorite job, How did you handle this kind of situation, this kind of person, etc. Everyone was very friendly and informative.
Interview Questions: They asked how I would handle it if multiple people came to me, all needing their project done right away. How I would prioritize the tasks.

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Meridian, ID) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online; then received a phone call for an interview the following week. Was a sit down with two managers, and they took turns asking me questions. I came in well dressed groomed and with a copy of my resume and letter of recommendation. The management made good eye contact and it was a very easy going stress-less interview.
Interview Questions: What I liked to do in my spare time, my goals and aspirations, what brought me to St. Luke's, My experience with customer interaction and retail knowledge.

title: Human Resources Compensation Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Three interviewers showed up about 20 minutes late. Explicitly stated they would call and let me know one way or the other after the interview. That was two years ago and I'm still waiting.
Interview Questions: Salary requirements.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: After you apply online you get to watch the status of your application. You'll first get a on the phone interview with an HR rep. They ask you experience, hardships, expectations, give basic job over view and tell you what to expect next. After that if they like you, you will then have an in person interview  with 1 or 2 reps, either together or separately in a huge room with 30 other people. This was during a huge hiring process they did in 2016. If they want you then you will get a call after this. They focus on a lot of team building exercises so you'll learn who the other people in the room are. They make it a very enjoyable experience.
Interview Questions: They had basic questions: memorable work experience

title: RN In the ER Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I took this job because I had the most fun in an interview I have ever had.  We were laughing and giggling; yes, they asked me tough questions but between those, we had a good time.  I left the interview thinking I wanted to work with these people.
Interview Questions: Scenerio questions primarily, ie:  Your patient has a 46 blood glucose, what do you do?  You are given a syringe of medication and told to give it.  What would you do?  Pt has these symptoms, what do you think is going on?

title: Patient Service and Billing Representative Contract Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Houston, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: very professional and covers all needed in Patient care and Billing accuracy and training session. my interviewer focus and record the session. she's pleasant and assure me for the job if I can start tomorrow. how efficient , and so I was hired.
Interview Questions: How long have you Stay in your present job or last job ?

title: Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: HR took weeks to call me back.  By the time I had been asked to come in for an interview I already had another job and couldn't remember what position they were talking about.  The job description is a generic list of duties that never specified what the actual job would be.  The interview went smoothly but not knowing what the actual job consisted of, was difficult.
Interview Questions: Basic things, how would former supervisors speak of you, are you willing to put in the time, etc.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Kansas City, MO) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR initially and then with clinic manager and staff. They were professional and friendly. The questions were typical interview questions, they didn't ask anything that I wasn't expecting.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed over the phone with HR, then interviewed over the phone with Unit Manager. Was brought to site for a brief tour and had an additional Panel interview with the current nurses working in unit and manager.
Interview Questions: Previous pertinent clinical experience

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with HR recruiter.  Then interviewed over the phone with Director of Department.  Came in for an in person panel interview and skill demonstration.  The interview was over about 3 hours; since this was for an OR position they had me change clothes and demonstrate sterile technique in the OR.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict in the workplace?

title: Reconciliation Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: A lengthy profile must be created online before you can apply for positions. Once you've applied, HR will contact you if you are being considered. A phone screening is first, followed by a panel interview, then a 2nd interview with an offer. If accepted, HR will contact you via phone with salary and benefits  confirmation. Then, you have to provide proof of immunizations, take a drug and tobacco test, and a quick physical.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Connect Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied for job and revived a call for an interview three days later. I was interview the supervisor and another person from HR and it last about 30 minutes. It was located at the building I would have worked at for st lukes.
Interview Questions:
Why would you been a good candidate for this job? 
How well of a team player are you?

title: Payroll Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went smoothly.  I met with the manager and was contacted by a recruiter that offered me the position. Then I had to go in to be drug tested and receive a few shots to make sure I was current.  The even checked for color blindness!
Interview Questions: Did I mind working in a position that had a lot of manual tasks/data entry?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: They called the day before they wanted to interview me.  I was able to fit it into my schedule.  I was interviewed by a panel of three people.  They asked mostly behavioral interview questions. (i.e. tell us about a time when...)
Interview Questions: Q. Tell us about a time when you made a mistake and how you handled it.

title: Transporter/Messenger Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: In person either with one manager or a panel. You will be asked about situations you might encounter that will make you feel uncomfortable, such as dealing with bodily fluids.  You will also talk about dealing with cadavers and if you're okay moving them. Pretty standard interview procedure apart from those two things.
Interview Questions: Are you okay with dealing with and seeing bodily fluids?

title: Medical Informatics Role Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straightforward, I applied online and got a phone call from an HR representative about a month or so later. I interviewed with the HR employee a week after the initial phone call and had a second interview with the hiring manager an hour later. One week after that I had 2 more interviews with higher level associates at 2 different campuses. The following week I was offered a position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you noticed that there was a significant problem with workflow, and what steps did you take to address it.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: They were professional and nice and ask well rehearsed questions and were professional and nice and created a comfortable environment they had a panel interview and appreciated that input from everyone
Interview Questions: What was one policy that you agreed or disagreed with and how did you over come that

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: When I applied for transfers within the St Luke's system the management was always very thorough with background and history, experience, what you could offer the office.
Interview Questions: Tell us something that that you feel you could do better at in your job.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: Simple, one interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System
Interview Descriptions: All applications are submitted online. Process is long due to the number of applications, they have the luxury of picking and choosing. It is best to have a referral from someone who works for the system.
Interview Questions: None that I can remember. All seemed to be very focused on the job duties.

title: Server Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: 3 total interview. spaced over 4-5 weeks with very little idea of how you are doing. They have to interview every single employee that applies to a position from janitor to surgeon so it takes a while.
Interview Questions: Standard windows server questions and how you handle confrontation.

title: Officer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Kansas City, MO) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Sit down interview with Surgical Director after sending in my resume to HR dept. They set up interview after reviewing my resume online. I also interviewed with the Director of Diagnostic Director.
Interview Questions: My work history in the medical field

title: Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Allentown, PA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: You must pass an initial online exam which seems to be a way to make sure you fit the culture.  The an interview with the manager of the area and skill test.
Interview Questions: Asked about employment history, and if there were any direct patient care issues.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: It seems to take St. Luke's an unusual extended time to process job applications.  It could be 4-6 weeks before you hear anything, if they give you a response at all.  I’ve had the experience of getting the form email  letter, “thanks, but, no thanks” and, have also had where they sent me nothing; so you are left hanging. Past experiences I’ve left messages for supervisors &/or recruiters with my name, phone number, etc. and asked they return my call—which I never received.  I find that is poor business etiquette and just plain rude.
Interview Questions: It’s all the behavioral interview questions before a group—could be 4 people, or could be 6 or 7.  The usual “tell us about a situation where you gave great customer service” and, you tell your story.  Some questions as, “what book are you reading now”, or, “what animal would you like to be”.  Sometimes I feel it’s all a popularity contest in the end.

title: Clinical Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel the first day then different managers the next. It was a formal process and everyone was professional. The job was posted as being "flexible" but I learned that hours were not flexible during the interviewing process. I turned the job down when I was offered $20/hour for part time. That salary was $7/hr below the The state avg for a dietitian. I accepted an offer 6 mos later at another Boise hospital for $35/hour with benefits.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a difficult situation with another employee in the past

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: You will get a phone call and an interview from the HR recruiter.  Email back and forth for the interview and the HR department will give you a final call with an offer if you get one.  Just be aware they work their people to the bone.
Interview Questions: What model would you use for proficiency testing in the Laboratory.  The correct answer is the Donna Wright model.

title: Staffing Technician Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions:
HR contacted me a few days after I had applied and set an interview time for the next day. HR told me who I would be interviewing with as well.
The interview took about an hour with the supervisor and lead technician.
After the interview  they had proceeded to show me the office that I would be working in and giving me a basic run down of the daily tasks that they do there. They had asked me to hang out as long as I would like. I ended up staying there for another hour and a half.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Audiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Twin Falls, ID) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Four person interview, Two doctors, one audiologist, and one upper management.  Very typical type of interview/questions.
Interview Questions: Very standard nothing unexpected.

title: Patient Care Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: My experience was this interview process was good; hiring process was actually very quick, and organized. However, in more recent times, the interview/selection process has become very long and unclear. Many positions are posted that are already reserved for someone. Very slow responses and process for scheduling interviews.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Twin Falls, ID) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Hard to get hired!
Interview Questions: Do you have plans of moving around witin the Company?

title: Patient Business Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. Luke's Health System (Boise, ID) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process takes forever! You can only apply online.Usually takes 6 weeks. Interviews tend to have  3-5 people asking questions.  Pretty standard questions. If you make the grade you will get another interview or offer, if not, an e-mail thanking you for your time.
Interview Questions: The questions are pretty standard.  Nothing unusual that stood out.
